name: meddling
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of trying to change or have an influence on things that are not your responsibility, especially by criticizing in a damaging or annoying way: High-ranking officials said there was no political meddling in the case. The ruling frees the technology industry to innovate and improve products without government meddling. See
meddle
More examplesFewer examplesThe Bill has great potential for unnecessary interference and bureaucratic meddling.He warned the West to "stop this meddling in our affairs."He irritated her at times with his incessant meddling.
